page.title: 19A HEALTHY DIET
page.content: There has been a lot of talk recently in the media about the fact that we are not eating a 'healthy diet'. We are supposed to be eating too much fat and not enough fibre, amongst other things. We decided to do our own check on how {healthy} our diet was. We kept a record of everything that we ate for 24 hrs & then processed it through our computer, using a program called DIET. We have averaged out the results and they are as follows: Average Requirements for 24 hrs Energy Protein Fat Carbohydrate Fibre 9.73Mj 56.18g 76g 280.1g 28.4g Average Intake over 24 hrs Energy Protein Fat Carbohydrate Fibre 10.55Mj 74.32g 93g 354.4g 28.2g {We would seem to be eating too much protein, fat and carbohydrate - as the media says - but we are just about right on fibre, contrary to the media}!
